lead_paragraph: Schlumberger’s shareholders have been in a state since news leaked last week of the company’s bid for Smith International, its rival in the oilfield services sector. Skeptical investors have since stripped more than $5 billion from the value of Schlumberger, the industry leader, a powerful slap in the face of its chief, Andrew F. Gould. Such punishment appears excessive, Reuters Breakingviews says.
